description:
Haven Life is an insurtech innovator at MassMutual that offers a new way to get life insurance online thats actually simple.

We combine the culture of a startup with the stability and backing of a Fortune 100 company to create an environment thats truly unique.

Our diverse team is comprised of smart, collaborative people who think big, execute quickly and dont take themselves too seriously. Were located in New Yorks Flatiron District and in case youre wondering, yes, we provide free snacks. Cold brew too.

If youre creative, professional and kind, wed love to hear from you.

 

ABOUT OUR INTERNSHIP PROGRAM:

You will be joining a small, experienced technology team responsible for our advanced online financial services application. As a contributing member of the team, you will have the opportunity to own and deliver a meaningful project throughout your internship. During this time, you will work closely with experienced software engineers, receiving mentorship and guidance, and contributing to both our complex platform as well as to our collaborative, inclusive culture. You’ll get to work with cutting edge technologies such as Typescript, Node.js, Angular 6, Postgres and AWS.

Working with other developers in an agile environment, you might work on items such as: 

  • Developing additions to as well as evolving how we currently underwrite our policies
  • Developing tools that will help us process large quantities of insurance applications from several different sources
  • Defining and applying rule sets for third party data feeds
  • Work on integrations with third party APIs and services
  • Contribute to and develop quality microservices
  • Contribute to the bread and butter of our organization: the apps! You can develop customer facing components on several different applications

Our work is varied and challenging, and you get to be an integral part of that. Our full-time summer internship program will last 10 weeks. Will begin in June 2021. You will be part of a small cohort of other interns. Join us for a summer full of learning, building and collaborating!

WHAT WE’D LOVE TO SEE FROM YOU:

  • Rising Senior or Master’s student pursuing a degree in Computer Science or related field (Spring 2022 Grad) 
  • Experience with traditional object oriented languages (e.g. Java, Javascript, C++)
  • Exposure to modern MVC (Model-view-controller) frameworks and front end frameworks such as Angular or React
  • Solid grounding in data driven applications and concepts (data/object modeling, database systems)
  • Enthusiasm about technology,  new trends in the tech space, etc.
  • Excellent problem-solving abilities
  • Comfortable expressing points of view while respecting those of others
  • Research / papers in CS 
  • Participation in CS-related  clubs, events, hackathons or side projects 
  • Authorized to work in the US with or without sponsorship
  • Must be able to work full-time from our Manhattan office throughout the internship  

 

The privacy of your personal information is important to us, click here to review our privacy notice

MassMutual is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Individual with Disability/Protected Veteran. We welcome all persons to apply. POSITION SUMMARY:
Under the general direction of the Vice President of Market Research, and in partnership with cross-functional internal partners, this hands-on role works primarily on Voice of the Customer primary market research and related analysis. This role requires significant coordination with cross-functional stakeholders. The role also coordinates the work of preferred partner vendors to augment the team's capacity and identifies when an elevated level of expertise is warranted to support project objectives. This role manages the CXI team's intern and may manage full time direct reports. The Market Manager will have an attention to detail and be a proactive, critical thinker who is interested and able to work in a matrixed, team-oriented organization where all team members take responsibility for the quality and timeliness of work while exemplifying the company's guiding principles.

In addition, the market research manager works closely with a number of key roles, stakeholders and functions across the organization to include but not limited to the following: business stakeholders (sales), financial analysts, customer operations, customer solutions, distribution operations and marketing. S/he needs to be a creative thinker and propose innovative approaches to data collection and analyses. The market research manager should know statistical methods and internal data sets to complete research projects. In addition, the market research manager will understand and effectively employ a number of ways to visualize data in a way that is highly effective and persuasive.

Finally, the market research manager must be inherently analytical and have a high level of curiosity in getting to next level understanding of insights behind the data. Excellent written and communications skills will also be a necessity for this role.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Reviews research briefs to understand objectives and consults on the design of surveys to ensure the data collected will facilitate the right analysis to generate findings that support the objectives
Independently programs and tests surveys, including the development of call to action and thank you messages, uploads respondent data, and deploys surveys
Integrates data from outside sources into Qualtrics and utilizes Qualtrics analytical tools to develop findings
Builds dashboards, provides training on optimal use, and continuously finds ways to improve data visualizations and incorporate new Qualtrics features within the dashboards
Calculates required respondents to achieve desired confidence level. Checks and ensures data validity. Identifies when advanced analytical techniques are appropriate.
Conducts analysis of Voice of the Customer data. Demonstrates strong proficiency with all Qualtrics analytical tools.
Identifies and integrates secondary data sources into the VOC analysis in order to improve the specificity and actionability of the analysis, findings and recommendations.
Demonstrates insightful quantitative understanding of a data set. Manipulates, analyzes and visualizes data to reveal trends in customer expectations and customer perceptions of company's performance. Identifies correlations in the data, including value drivers. Elevates key opportunities where improvement will have the greatest impact.
Actively participates with the CXI team in presentations and workshops where findings and recommendations to improve the CX are discussed and debated. Interprets VOC analysis and effectively communicates statistical concepts in way that makes it easy to understand and is not intimidating to non-technical audiences
With the hands-on support of the Vice President of Market Research, and preferred partners, prepares findings reports for senior executives. Using Microsoft PowerPoint, develops reports with clear, compelling, and easy to interpret data visualizations along with a narrative that translates the data into insights that convey a story or distinct point of view.
Becomes the company's foremost expert use of Qualtrics, a best-in-class technology for research and analysis. Continuously improves proficiency in utilizing all aspects of the tool, particularly those related to analysis. May support the training other associates. Stays current on knowledge of new features/functionality and proactively brings ideas for how these can be applied to support the team's goals
Generates timely and concise communications appropriate for executive leadership to understand project status and pending issues.
Monitors response rates to surveys and proactively makes recommendations on when additional action is required to accelerate participation
Maintains a tracking program to report on budget allocated to donations in association with charitable giving for survey incentives
Collaborates with IT, preferred vendors, and others to problem-solve through data integration requirements, survey deployment decisions, and other operational considerations related to the VOC and customer experience programs
Manages the intern's workflow/priorities, reviews all work contributed by intern, and provides guidance and coaching to support the intern's professional development.
Proactively recommends ideas to improving efficiency and quality in the team's workflows, processes, and deliverables
Builds and maintains strong relationships across the organization through frequent and open communication/collaboration
Proactively seeks out and manages time to accommodate for continuous learning and development.

EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:
Typical Education
Minimum of bachelors (advanced degree (Masters or PHD preferred) in data analytics, marketing research, statistics or computer science or related field;
Typically requires 3+ years of relevant quantitative and qualitative research and analytics experience.
Solid knowledge of statistical techniques and research methodologies.
Knowledge of one or more market research platforms (e.g. Qualtrics, R, Sawtooth, SPSS, Medallion)
Proficiency in the use of statistical methodologies (regression, maxdiff, conjoint, Turf analysis, correlation, descriptive variables).
Proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics and multivariate testing
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Knowledge of one or more business/functional areas.

Work Complexity
Designs experiments, tests hypotheses and builds statistical models.
Employs a number of complex research methodologies (correlation matrices, turf analysis, conjoint analysis, max diff)
Highly skilled in running bivariate and simple multivariate statistics

Market Research
Design, test and program surveys to support VOC programs and other insight projects
Designs qualitative and quantitative studies and aligns them to the proper use case.
Identifies audience size, sample size, confidence level and confidence interval necessary to meet statistical validation

Strategic Planning & Project Planning
Participates in team strategic planning sessions to support annual and long-range objectives.
Creates and manages research project plans and tracks key milestones

Business Requirements
Works with commercial and functional stakeholders to define business problems and develop research methodologies to gather the necessary insights that inform recommendations
Possesses a high-level understanding of one or more business or functional areas.
Develops key business stakeholder relationships.
Leverages knowledge of internal and external data sources and leverages this knowledge to solve business problems
Data Requirements
Works with others to support data collection in support of research projects and integration of internal systems (e.g. Qualtrics with SFDC) to automate data transfer.
Works to combine customer experience data (e.g. satisfaction) and operational data (e.g. financial) to complete robust analyses and findings.

Analytics
Solves business analytics problems and communicates results and methodologies.
Works in iterative processes with business stakeholders and validates findings.
Develops experimental design approaches to validate findings or test hypotheses.
Validates analysis by comparing appropriate samples.

Communications and Presentation
Presents and depicts the rationale of findings in easy to understand terms for the business and functional groups.
Highly effective visual depiction of data, trends, charts, graphs in compelling fashion.
Communicates and works with stakeholders and other SME's as required to meet project objectives.

Ideally this would be someone with healthcare experience and has done B2B work. Familiar with SPSS, Qualtrics, R, Sawtooth and other market research, statistical software.

Job Description:

Web Design/Developer Intern

The Digital Marketing team is looking for a Web Design/Developer Intern for kodak.com to improve the user experience and site functionality in support of marketing and sales objectives. The ideal candidate should be a motivated self-starter with the ability to work independently as well as collaborate with a cross-functional team.
 
The intern’s responsibilities will range from routine maintenance to the build out of new web functionality. The intern will work closely with other technical resources to meet business needs while creating visually appealing pages that feature user-friendly designs. 
 
Responsibilities
  • Assist with ongoing website updates
  • Improve content and images based on web design and SEO best practices
  • Research, recommend, and document improvements for page design and web functionality
  • Assist with building new features and enhancing existing features
Required Skills and Experience
  • Currently enrolled in a Web Marketing, New Media Design/Development, Computer Science or related program
  • Experience with HTML, CSS and JavaScript
  • Capable of creating responsive design interfaces with a clean, visual design aesthetic
  • Experience using Adobe Creative Suite
  • Strong understanding of UI, cross-browser compatibility, general web functions and standards
  • Ability to perform quality assurance testing and apply solutions when problems are encountered
  • Comfortable in a deadline-driven environment
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Willing to learn new technologies and skills 
Desired Skills
  • Experience working with a web CMS
  • Familiar with modern web frameworks (Vue JS, React, Angular, etc.)
  • Experience with Ajax (REST API, GraphQL)
  • Familiar with versioning and repository use for programming (GitHub, Bitbucket, etc.)
  • Familiar with accessibility and compliance regulations (WCAG 2.1)
  • Familiar with analytics tools (Google Analytics, Tag Manager, etc.)

Welcome to Valmont, where a world of opportunity awaits. When you join our team, you become part of a passionate group dedicated to changing lives and conserving resources around the globe. We want problem solvers who roll up their sleeves to foster progress and innovation for all people. At Valmont, we provide infrastructure, irrigation, tubing and coatings to the world. We strengthen cities. We nourish croplands. We design, manufacture and coat. Our products and services make a difference. Join us, and BUILD YOUR WORLD.

A Brief Summary of This Position:

Valmont is seeking a Data Analyst Intern to join the Irrigation division. The Data Analyst goal is to drive understanding and decision making from data, on a strategic and tactical level. The Analyst is accountable for planning, supporting and launching efficient business and operations systems/processes to the Sales team, with focus on quality improvement, data management, and process improvement and/or re-engineering.  This includes gathering and analyzing data in support of business cases, proposed projects, and systems requirements. Other tasks include cleaning large datasets and assist in building a data validation process. Our ideal candidate has the ability to work on multiple business projects simultaneously and translate business data into digestible information that improve processes.

Valmont’s internship program mission is to provide a hands-on learning experience through project work, leadership development, job shadowing and interaction with senior leadership.

Essential Functions:

  • Perform analysis of data sets to identify trends, relationships and insights
  • Collaborate with subject matter experts and data engineers to develop new data products
  • Implement modifications to existing workflow processes to improve systems 
  • Address any data discrepancy issues across all open projects
  • Take on ad hoc projects and cultivate your own ideas
  • Deliver findings through impactful data visualizations and effective storytelling techniques
  • Experience in Power BI a plus

Required Qualifications of Every Candidate (Education, Experience, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities):

  •  Working towards a degree in Business, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Finance, or any quantitative discipline 
  • The ability to dedicate 20-25 hours a week
  • A keen eye for detail and dedication to accuracy and quality
  • A strong working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook and Power Point
  • Self-starter and ability to work well in a team environment
  • An analytical mind and inclination for problem solving
  • Passion and integrity with the drive to excel and deliver exceptional results

Benefits:

  • Great opportunity to gain career related course work experience from an industry leader
  • Paid Internship – Valmont values you
  • Potential development into a regular full-time position
  • Flexible full-time day shift hours during the summer
  • A thriving culture in a growing business
  • Interactive group activities with intern peers

Working Environment and Physical Efforts:

Work is typically performed in an office setting.  The incumbent is regularly required to sit for extended periods of time, as well as talk and listen on the phone and in personal conversations or meetings.    Environment is fast paced and demanding most of the time.  No travel requirements for this position.  The employee frequently is required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms while working in the office with various files and forms and while working on the computer.  The employee is occasionally required to move about the office.  Incumbent must utilize proper ergonomic safeguards such as monitor height and positions, keyboard location and height and proper wrists rests. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 15 pounds in working with large files, binders, and computer equipment.  Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, and depth perception.

Valmont does not discriminate against any employee or applicant in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by law.  Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Overview

Department

  • Global Sales Operations

Mentor's Title:

  • Manager, Global Sales Technology

This position will support corporate initiatives and programs utilizing the salesforce.com platform. This position will be responsible for the data in Leviton's sales management pipeline system. Poor data is the #1 reason CRM systems fail, making data management very important. In addition, this intern will assist in process improvement while supporting each business unit / channel utilizing salesforce.com.

Responsibilities

  • Utilize a system's resources and tools to drive decisions regarding the data
  • Responsible for overseeing our data management application, Validity, and its connection to Salesforce.com
  • Comply with departmental procedures as well as find areas for process improvement
  • Serve as the data manager and incorporate new processes, policies, and guidelines to administer a central database
  • Understanding a systems platform through building custom functionality, data modeling, and data management
  • Driving user engagement across all sales systems through providing training and support
  • Basic understanding of project management methodology
  • Additional duties as assigned

Qualifications

Education & Experience

  • Update the degrees to Technology, Business, Data Analytics
  • Must be a student currently enrolled as a sophomore or higher pursing a degree in Technology, Behavior Sciences, Business, or Marketing
  • Must have the ability to read, analyze and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, and / or governmental regulations
  • Must have excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Must have strong presentation skills and well developed interpersonal skills
  • Must be proficient in MS Excel, PowerPoint, and MS Word and have the ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, percentages, and other statistical calculations
  • Must have strong research, analytical, and critical thinking skills Programming / coding knowledge is favored
  • Desired Major: Information Technology / Computer Science / Business
  • Work Schedule: Flexible with school schedule
  • 20-29 hours per week

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy. Looking to put your learning to the test and apply your education through an exciting summer opportunity with a Fortune 300 energy company? Come join a winning team with PSEG's internship program. Public Service Enterprise Group (PSEG) is a publicly traded (NYSE:PEG) diversified energy company headquartered in New Jersey, and one of the ten largest electric companies in the U.S.

PSEG Long Island Energy Efficiency Area is seeking a Planning and Evaluation Technical intern at our Melville location. As a summer intern for Energy Efficiency, you will b uild upon experience and knowledge developed in 2019 internship in the PSEG Long Island Planning and Evaluation department, this position will offer and opportunity for the intern to expand their knowledge of overall Energy Efficiency, Electric Vehicle and Non Wire Alternative efforts. The intern will be afforded a unique opportunity to work within PSEG Long Island's new and developing Datalake environment and provide opportunities for the intern to develop and demonstrate data science and analysis in support of the aforementioned areas. Assist the Energy Efficiency and Renewable Department in the areas of Electric Vehicle Charging Data analysis, Datalake querying and analysis, Non Wire alternative Request for Proposals development, and support in the launching a Pay for Performance Pilot program. The position will also be requested to support general program planning efforts for 2021 as requested based upon work requirements during the internship period.

The job duties include, but not limited to the following:
• Working with Engineer and Business Support Analyst to develop knowledge base of datalake, LodeStar and Microstrategies structure and functionality. • Developing capability in Tableau writer software capability and functionality. • Developing understanding of Juicebox and Chargepoint portals to support retrieval of customer charging data and export into Datalake. • Interfacing with all members of Planning and Evaluation team to provide data retrieval, analysis and presentation requirements. • Participate and support Energy Efficiency Planning efforts for the 2021 plan year. • Perform cost benefit analysis as requested.
Required Education/Skills : The successful candidate (s) must have interned in the PSEG Long Island Planning and Evaluation group in prior years, be actively pursuing a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution in business, math, engineering, economics, computer science or similar discipline. Candidates must have completed sophomore level course work for consideration. PSEG recognizes institutions of higher education, which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent.

Preferred Skills :

3.0 GPA

All PSEG internship roles are paid at an hourly rate, however there are no benefits associated with these positions. Candidates are expected to work 40 hours per week over the summer period for the full 10-12 week period. We are targeting currently enrolled students staying in the New York metro area for the duration of the internship and able to commute to the assigned work location. Housing, transportation, immigration Support will not be provided in association with these positions. As an employee of PSE&G or PSEG Long Island, you should be aware that during storm restoration efforts, you may be required to perform functions outside of your routine duties and on a schedule that may be different from normal operations.

This site ( http://www.pseg.com ) is strictly for candidates who are not currently PSEG employees. PSEG employees must apply for jobs internally through empower which can be accessed through the mypseg homepage by clicking on the employee center tab, then under the empower header, choose careers.

Business needs may cause PSEG to cancel or delay filling position at any time during the selection process.

Certain positions at the Company may require you to have access to Part 810-Controlled Information.  Under the law, the Company is limited in who it can share this information with and in certain circumstances it is necessary to obtain specific authorization before the Company can share this information.  Accordingly, if the position does require access to this information, you must complete a 10 CFR Part 810 Export Control Compliance Nationality Request Form, a copy of which will be provided to you by Talent Acquisition if an offer is made.  If there is a need for specific authorization, due to the time it takes to obtain authorization from the government, we will likely not be able to further proceed with an offer.

At Cadence, we hire and develop leaders and innovators who want to make an impact on the world of technology.

Position Description

Cadence Design Systems is seeking a highly motivated graduate student for internship in the Product Engineering team. The Cadence Digital and Signoff Group will offer you a dynamic environment in which you will work with innovative R&D and Customer Engagement teams to influence the development of software tools for advanced chip design platforms.

Position Responsibilities

Designing, developing, troubleshooting and debugging software programs on Unix/Linux platforms

Supporting Customers in performing successful tapeouts of their System-on-chip designs

Position Requirements

Currently enrolled in MS studies in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering

Experience with EDA tools and with VLSI design; familiar with digital implementation challenges including clock tree synthesis, routing, optimization and silicon signoff.

Experience with UNIX and/or LINUX platforms

Strong knowledge of Tcl

Strong analysis and problem solving skills

Excellent algorithmic skills

Team Player

Strong ability and passion to learn

Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Division: Cox Automotive

Job Level: Intern/Co-op

Travel: No

Schedule: Full-time

Shift: Day Job

Dealertrack, a brand of Cox Automotive, is currently looking for a UX Research Intern to join our Engineering team in Dallas, TX

Responsibilities:

  • Identify and execute research based on analysis of existing product designs, business needs, project goals, and risks.
  • Continuously gather knowledge about customers (Internal and external) through various channels (e.g. shadowing operations teams, customer interviews/feedback.)
  • Design and conduct user research studies, including surveys, in-depth interviews, and concept/prototype testing.
  • Analyze, synthesize and present findings to all stakeholders with clarity and agility using a combination of various user feedback and research tools and your own methodologies.
  • Communicate findings and opportunities in clear, concise, and compelling ways to stakeholders.
  • Foster collaboration with designers, product managers, marketers, and operations to translate insights into actionable recommendations that inform execution.

During this time you will:

  • Become acquainted with our products, the product goals, and those you will work closely with.
  • Independently start to study and learn the Partner product suite.
  • Start shadowing key operational teams
  • Start participating in User Research Calls.

Qualifications:

  • Currently studying for a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or other Technology degree. For Under Grad students, must be a rising junior or rising senior level (at least 2 years college completed). Graduate students in a technology degree may also apply.
  • Solid understanding of best practices for conducting research (qualitative and quantitative) in user experience, product design, or technology contexts. Bonus points if you have done this remotely in the past.
  • Strong analytical and synthesis skills with a proven ability to turn research results into product insights.
  • Strong understanding of statistical concepts and how to apply them in the context of user experience research.
  • Self-motivated and execution oriented. Ability to execute at a high level of quality in a fast-paced, complex environment.
  • Ability to create compelling presentations and confidently convey insights through storytelling.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to influence a range of audiences.
  • Ability to work independently and take initiative to solve problems.
  • Experience conducting remote research is considered a plus.

Internship Criteria:

  • Internship is not eligible for sponsorship
  • Preference is given to rising Seniors, Juniors and Masters students (Dec 2021, May 2022 or May 2023 graduates)
  • Field of study relevant to role
  • Ability to work approximately 10 weeks over summer months
  • Ability to work remotely

Who We Are

About Cox Automotive

Theres nothing ordinary about Cox Automotive. We are people of every background driven by our passion for mobility, innovation, client success and community outreach. We make buying, selling and owning (or simply using) cars easier for everyone. Touching more than 40,000 clients across five continents, we bring together the best brands and the best teams to propel the automotive industry forward. Some of those team members work for our iconic consumer brands like Autotrader and Kelley Blue Book, while others are creating the future of automotive at industry-facing brands like Dealer.com, Manheim and vAuto.

About Cox

We are the Cox family of businesses. Weve been making our mark since 1898 by building and evolving world-class businesses, staying true to our values, and encouraging top talent to always look for growth and impact while building a career with us. Our primary divisions - Cox Communications and Cox Automotive - are driving a new wave of innovation, powering smart cities with powerhouse broadband communications and pioneering greener, more progressive transportation alternatives for individuals and fleet operators. Were also expanding into new spaces like cleantech and healthcare to rev up our momentum toward building a better future for the next generation. Were looking for the talent today who will be our leaders tomorrow. Sound intriguing? At Cadence, we hire and develop leaders and innovators who want to make an impact on the world of technology.

At Cadence, you’ll be part of a team that’s passionate about innovation and excited to work together to make a difference. We empower you as a future leader to collaborate with our global teams, develop ideas, and then run with them.

Key Qualifications

Currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate program in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or related fields
Will be graduating with a minimum of a Bachelors degree by August 2021
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong teamwork skills with the ability to collaborate with multiple geographies and cross-functionally.
Experience varies depending on area of interest but may include the following: C/C++, Python, Linux-based development, VLSI CAD algorithm development, designing data structures, algorithms, and software engineering principles

Description

Your time at Cadence will give you everything you need to launch your career. Below are the various areas within the Digital Signoff Group you can explore:

Characterization: You will be a member of an expert R&D team creating technologies and products that enable static and dynamic transistor level analysis and characterization of the most advanced custom digital and mixed-signal circuits built for communication, IOT and AI markets. Experience with quality and software processes, developing and maintaining  C++ based applications on a Unix or Linux environment. Proficiency designing data structures, algorithms, and software engineering principles.

DDI - Routing: Your focus area will be developing the next generation routing engine while working in a team environment to design, improve, and maintain core routing technology as part of Innovus Digital Implementation system. Routing algorithm knowledge is preferred to implement a robust and efficient routing engine.

DDI – Synthesis: You will be working with a mentor to develop and improve global placement and detailed placement QoR in Innovus Digital Implementation System. Strong problem solving, analysis, and programming skills are required.

Product Engineering: You will be part of a dynamic environment working with innovative R&D and Customer Engagement teams to influence the development of software tools for advanced chip design platforms. Designing, developing, troubleshooting and debugging software programs on Unix/Linux platforms. Supporting customers in performing successful tapeouts of their System-on-chip designs.

Machine Learning: You will be part of a high energy team exploring and implementing Machine Learning and Deep Learning techniques to Electronic Design Automation [EDA] tools. You would be involved with researching and developing Machine Learning approaches to problems in the EDA and system design, as well as designing, implementing, verifying and maintaining software to address those markets.

Tempus Timing Signoff: You will be responsible for designing, developing, troubleshooting and debugging software programs in the areas of static timing analysis with a focus on statistical analysis and incremental timing in presence of signal integrity effects. Experience with deep algorithmic knowledge and intent to build highly scalable solutions in C/C++, combined with passion to innovate.

Verification: You will be focused on developing algorithms in the physical design space. You will be exposed to the development of software for Physical Verification of Integrated Circuits in a cross-geographical, multi-cultural environment and given the opportunity to learn and develop solutions for Physical Verification, which includes testing, profiling and analyzing the performance of geometric and topological functions, as well as development of prototype geometric and topological functions for improved efficiency.

TITLE:                            Senior Data Scientist/Engineer

 

COMPANY:                    AMI Group, LLC

 

REPORTS TO:               Chief Executive Officer

 

SALARY RANGE:        $120,000 - $140,000

 

JOB SUMMARY

 

Primarily responsible for providing data science support for various projects within Chicago Parking Meters, LLC (“CPM”).  The Senior Data Scientist assists in overseeing the activities of the data analyst(s) and provides advanced expertise and guidance on statistical and mathematical concepts for the data and analytics team. The Senior Data Scientist applies and inspires the adoption of advanced data science and analytics across the business.

The Senior Data Scientist synthesizes and leverages CPM’s data to enhance the business’ capabilities for overall goal achievement. The Senior Data Scientist is instrumental in helping the business continue its evolution into an analytical and data-driven culture.

This role of the Senior Data Scientist supports relevant stakeholders through quantitative analytics, and the application of appropriate advanced analytics for CPM’s key initiatives.

ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES

 

  1. Provide advanced analysis, recommendations, and support for various projects within CPM. Projects include the rollout and ongoing performance measurement for CPM’s parking meter system and process improvements. The position will support and contribute to the success of these projects, including one or more of the following functions:

 

  1. Collect and manage project data, organize, analyze, and prepare reports on vendor and system performance.
  2. Develop statistical models in key areas of parking data including enforcement and demand.
  3. Assist in identifying and measuring Key Performance Indicators in numerous operational areas.
  4. Develop an understanding of the parking meter system requirements and project goals. Drawing upon this understanding and the collected project data, investigate options, draw conclusions and/or make recommendations as required.

 

  1. Manage the collection of meter data, which is supplied through the operator and meter equipment software and provide analysis of this data. As required, provide input and recommendations for leveraging this data to drive improved asset performance.

 

  1. Develop and support profitability analyses and models, including potential revenue, projected cost-savings, and operating efficiency maximization models. Recommend and develop automated processes for collecting data and managing output for these models. Participate in the development of industry leading work process, technology, revenue collection, and profitability analysis initiatives. 

 

  1. Implement and handle end-to-end data science products and analytics.

 

  1. Manipulate and extract ‘big data’ from large, disconnected datasets that can require complex queries and advanced knowledge of SQL with familiarity in a variety of databases.

 

  1. Work closely with team members and assist in developing the technical, statistical, and analytical skillsets of the data analyst(s). Direct and review the work of data analyst(s) and intern(s) to complete projects as required.

 

 


SKILLS, EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

 

At least five years of data science experience, preferably working as a Senior Data Scientist and/or Data Engineer.  The candidate must also have had substantial experience working on strategy or full-life cycle data science as well as experience working with data mining tools such as Python, SQL and R. A suitable candidate for this position will also have had experience in data mining and predictive modeling including linear and non-linear regression, logistic regression, and time series analysis models. Statistical machine learning experience is preferred.   The candidate will also have had experience working with deep learning algorithms and large datasets as well as experience working with unstructured data and experience cleaning and manipulating data.

The Senior Data Scientist should have at least a bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or any other related quantitative field.  A master’s degree in a similar analytical field is preferred. 

 

The candidate must have the ability to organize and prioritize work, and to interpret and present information clearly and professionally.  Must be proactive, meet assigned deadlines, be able to work both independently and as part of a team, must have a strong ability to mobilize people and work with both internal and external contacts.

 

 


All applicants will be afforded equal opportunity without discrimination because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identification, marital status, national origin or ancestry, age, physical or mental handicap unrelated to ability, or an unfavorable discharge from military service.

 

This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with scripting languages such as PowerShell, Bash and Python
  • Experience with virtualization, scripting automation and storage systems
  • Exposure to performing server, network and storage systems design, implementation and administration
  • Windows and Linux OS administration experience
  • Exposure to traditional enterprise platform management, server administration or relational databases  
  • Experience with infrastructure-as-a-service platforms such as AWS and Google Compute Engine
  • 3 or more years of work toward a bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field 
  • Experience with development using GitHub or TFS

Description: Our client is currently seeking a Market Research Manager

 
POSITION SUMMARY:
Under the general direction of the Vice President of Market Research, and in partnership with cross-functional internal partners, this hands-on role works primarily on Voice of the Customer primary market research and related analysis. This role requires significant coordination with cross-functional stakeholders. The role also coordinates the work of preferred partner vendors to augment the team’s capacity and identifies when an elevated level of expertise is warranted to support project objectives. This role manages the CXI team’s intern and may manage full time direct reports. The Market Manager will have an attention to detail and be a proactive, critical thinker who is interested and able to work in a matrixed, team-oriented organization where all team members take responsibility for the quality and timeliness of work while exemplifying AmerisourceBergen’s guiding principles. In addition, the market research manager works closely with a number of key roles, stakeholders and functions across the organization to include but not limited to the following: business stakeholders (sales), financial analysts, customer operations, customer solutions, distribution operations and marketing. S/he needs to be a creative thinker and propose innovative approaches to data collection and analyses. The market research manager should know statistical methods and internal data sets to complete research projects. In addition, the market research manager will understand and effectively employ a number of ways to visualize data in a way that is highly effective and persuasive. Finally, the market research manager must be inherently analytical and have a high level of curiosity in getting to next level understanding of insights behind the data. Excellent written and communications skills will also be a necessity for this role.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

· Reviews research briefs to understand objectives and consults on the design of surveys to ensure the data collected will facilitate the right analysis to generate findings that support the objectives
· Independently programs and tests surveys, including the development of call to action and thank you messages, uploads respondent data, and deploys surveys
· Integrates data from outside sources into Qualtrics and utilizes Qualtrics analytical tools to develop findings
· Builds dashboards, provides training on optimal use, and continuously finds ways to improve data visualizations and incorporate new Qualtrics features within the dashboards
· Calculates required respondents to achieve desired confidence level. Checks and ensures data validity. Identifies when advanced analytical techniques are appropriate.
· Conducts analysis of Voice of the Customer data. Demonstrates strong proficiency with all Qualtrics analytical tools.
· Identifies and integrates secondary data sources into the VOC analysis in order to improve the specificity and actionability of the analysis, findings and recommendations.
· Demonstrates insightful quantitative understanding of a data set. Manipulates, analyzes and visualizes data to reveal trends in customer expectations and customer perceptions of AmerisourceBergen’s performance. Identifies correlations in the data, including value drivers. Elevates key opportunities where improvement will have the greatest impact.
· Actively participates with the CXI team in presentations and workshops where findings and recommendations to improve the CX are discussed and debated. Interprets VOC analysis and effectively communicates statistical concepts in way that makes it easy to understand and is not intimidating to non-technical audiences
· With the hands-on support of the Vice President of Market Research, and preferred partners, prepares findings reports for senior executives. Using Microsoft PowerPoint, develops reports with clear, compelling, and easy to interpret data visualizations along with a narrative that translates the data into insights that convey a story or distinct point of view.
· Becomes AmerisourceBergen’s foremost expert use of Qualtrics, a best-in-class technology for research and analysis. Continuously improves proficiency in utilizing all aspects of the tool, particularly those related to analysis. May support the training other associates. Stays current on knowledge of new features/functionality and proactively brings ideas for how these can be applied to support the team’s goals
· Generates timely and concise communications appropriate for executive leadership to understand project status and pending issues.
· Monitors response rates to surveys and proactively makes recommendations on when additional action is required to accelerate participation
· Maintains a tracking program to report on budget allocated to donations in association with charitable giving for survey incentives
· Collaborates with IT, preferred vendors, and others to problem-solve through data integration requirements, survey deployment decisions, and other operational considerations related to the VOC and customer experience programs
· Manages the intern’s workflow/priorities, reviews all work contributed by intern, and provides guidance and coaching to support the intern’s professional development.
· Proactively recommends ideas to improving efficiency and quality in the team’s workflows, processes, and deliverables
· Builds and maintains strong relationships across the organization through frequent and open communication/collaboration
· Proactively seeks out and manages time to accommodate for continuous learning and development.

EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

Typical Education
· Minimum of bachelors (advanced degree (Masters or PHD preferred) in data analytics, marketing research, statistics or computer science or related field;
· Typically requires 3+ years of relevant quantitative and qualitative research and analytics experience.
· Solid knowledge of statistical techniques and research methodologies.
· Knowledge of one or more market research platforms (e.g. Qualtrics, R, Sawtooth, SPSS, Medallion)
· Proficiency in the use of statistical methodologies (regression, maxdiff, conjoint, Turf analysis, correlation, descriptive variables).
· Proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics and multivariate testing
· Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
· Knowledge of one or more business/functional areas.

Work Complexity
· Designs experiments, tests hypotheses and builds statistical models.
· Employs a number of complex research methodologies (correlation matrices, turf analysis, conjoint analysis, max diff)
· Highly skilled in running bivariate and simple multivariate statistics

Market Research
· Design, test and program surveys to support VOC programs and other insight projects
· Designs qualitative and quantitative studies and aligns them to the proper use case.
· Identifies audience size, sample size, confidence level and confidence interval necessary to meet statistical validation

Strategic Planning & Project Planning
· Participates in team strategic planning sessions to support annual and long-range objectives.
· Creates and manages research project plans and tracks key milestones

Business Requirements
· Works with commercial and functional stakeholders to define business problems and develop research methodologies to gather the necessary insights that inform recommendations
· Possesses a high-level understanding of one or more business or functional areas.
· Develops key business stakeholder relationships.
· Leverages knowledge of internal and external data sources and leverages this knowledge to solve business problems
Data Requirements
· Works with others to support data collection in support of research projects and integration of internal systems (e.g. Qualtrics with SFDC) to automate data transfer.
· Works to combine customer experience data (e.g. satisfaction) and operational data (e.g. financial) to complete robust analyses and findings.

Analytics
· Solves business analytics problems and communicates results and methodologies.
· Works in iterative processes with business stakeholders and validates findings.
· Develops experimental design approaches to validate findings or test hypotheses.
· Validates analysis by comparing appropriate samples.

Communications and Presentation
· Presents and depicts the rationale of findings in easy to understand terms for the business and functional groups.
· Highly effective visual depiction of data, trends, charts, graphs in compelling fashion.
· Communicates and works with stakeholders and other SME’s as required to meet project objectives.

Job Purpose:

This position is responsible for the management, development, and user support of the GIS and other engineering systems and tools that are used in support of the outside plant and access network planning. Additionally, this position is responsible for designing, developing, deploying and maintaining a data base system for dashboards and reports within the engineering organization. These systems directly support the corporate strategic direction in the planning and design of CBT's evolving access and outside plant network to provide the best customer experience along with capital efficiency, ease of service and network reliability. This position has a direct impact on the success of corporate's network initiatives by supporting complex business problems through use of systems and data from multiple resources.

Essential Functions:

  • Perform advanced GIS functions including models, scripting and application development
  • Utilize GIS and associated software to produce, display, and analyze geographic information; creates case maps for internal and external customers
  • Develops ArcGIS Pro projects/layouts for the fulfillment of data requests as necessary
  • Designs cartographic and other visual graphic output
  • Assist with GIS mobile data collection processes such as ArcPad, Arc GIS for iOS or other related data collection technologies
  • Prepare, update, and maintain graphic displays, databases, reports, statistical information and maps as requested
  • Assists in the collection of various types of mapping data from both internal and external sources
  • Interpret various information from applications to GIS files, such as survey drawings, site development plans, subdivision plans, plats
  • Assist internal customers with map production and analysis of spatial database information
  • Provide technical support to train and assist system users in new and existing GIS applications
  • Organizes, creates, manipulates, enters and retrieves GIS data for reporting, analysis, and presentation purposes
  • Serve as GIS liaison between IT, Data Analytics, Network Ops, and external clients including setup and management of data connections
  • Set up and manage user access to GIS system including management of software licenses
  • Build compelling, interactive and actionable reporting and dashboards on top of structured data models that help in deriving meaningful business insights
  • Support the full lifecycle from requirements analysis through design and development as well as release and support phases
  • Produce models incorporating multiple data sources into reports and make recommendations which enable decision making
  • Provide ad-hoc reporting support and activities in a collaborative environment

Education:

  • Four years of College resulting in a Bachelor's Degree or equivalent
  • Bachelor's Degree in Geography, GIS, Computer Science, Planning, Engineering, Surveying or related field

General Work Experience:

2 to 3 years

Previous Work Experience:

  • 2 years experience working with engineering system and tools including working with large amounts of data from various data resources
  • Experience in the use and administration of Esri ArcGis as well as advanced GIS functions including models and scripting
  • Advanced knowledge of GIS-related software, products and services: Python, C#, Sql.
  • Experience with visualizations within Power BI (or similar) using multiple sources such as SQL server, Excel, Esri ArcGis
  • Skill in researching, compiling, and summarizing statistical data and information materials
  • Utility industry background preferred with knowledge of utility infrastructure components
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships and communications with internal and external customers
  • Ability to work remotely, organize work, establish priorities, meet established deadlines, and follow up on assignments with a minimum of direction
  • Python, JavaScript, Java, SQL preferred

Special Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Esri ArcGis experience is required
  • Oracle and Sql database experience required

Supervisory Responsibility:

Co-op, intern or contractor resources as needed

The Systems Support Analyst ensures successful completion of company objectives at the infrastructure level. The main focus of the Systems Support Analyst is to program and configure company based business systems and support computer Virtualization requirements.

  • Provide Tier 2 Technical Support for internal company systems.

Requirements

description:
Description de la mission

Summary of Job Purpose:

Internship opportunity to work with a team to execute specific projects and receive on the job training while gaining professional experience.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
o This person will work with executive leadership to understand and define requirements of our leadership management system and process in order to tailor our IT tools to support simple, effective, and efficient monitoring and control of our key performance indicators (KPIs). Our management system includes a regular process to set goals, measure performance against those goals, and take action to control our performance. These KPIs include such things as sales, gross margin, R&D spend, staffing, on-time delivery, quality, and more.
o This work can be broken up into discrete projects, which can be started and completed during this internship.
o This position will also work with leadership to lay out the vision and roadmap of future expansion of the IT tools and management system to meet the business needs.
o This person will also work with others across different sites in Southern California, Texas, and Mexico to ensure their underlying KPI's are consumable by the IT tools for the Executive Leadership KPI's and management system.
o Current IT tools include SAP, Power BI, excel, powerpoint, and we welcome additional recommendations.
o This role will also include the rollout and training of users

Description complémentaire

Physical Requirements :

Office
o While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk.
o The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision.
o The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet.

Votre profil

Required Competencies:

Education / Experience:
o Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree from an accredited college or university in Engineering or Computer Science
o Legally authorized to work in the US without company sponsorship
o This position requires use of information or access to hardware, which is subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). All applicants must be U.S. persons within the meaning of ITAR. ITAR defines a U.S. person as a U.S. Citizen, U.S. Permanent Resident (i.e. 'Green Card Holder'), Political Asylee, or Refugee
o Fulfill all Environmental, Safety & Health requirements and act in a safe and environmentally responsible manner at all times. This includes, following all ES&H policies and procedures, acting on unsafe conditions and aiding Leadership in the attainment of ES&H initiatives and continuous improvement efforts.

Skills and Abilities:
o Strong Mathematics and Statistics knowledge
o Excellent oral and written communication skills
o Dependability - Ensures that all details of a project are accurate before delegating to others.
o Detail Orientation - Rarely makes errors but accepts responsibility for those that are made and develops a plan to prevent similar errors from recurring.
o Listening - Consistently practices attentive and active listening and can accurately restate the opinions of others.
o Relationships - Develops relationships with others that are based on trust.
o Time Management - Works from a daily to-do list but will re-organize if priorities suddenly shift. Ability to make timely decisions even if the face of complexity, balancing systematic analysis with decisiveness

Entité de rattachementSafran Electronics & Defense

Safran est un groupe international de haute technologie opérant dans les domaines de l'aéronautique (propulsion, équipements et intérieurs), de l'espace et de la défense. Sa mission : contribuer durablement à un monde plus sûr, où le transport aérien devient toujours plus respectueux de l'environnement, plus confortable et plus accessible. Implanté sur tous les continents, le Groupe emploie 79 000 collaborateurs pour un chiffre d'affaires de 16,5 milliards d'euros en 2020, et occupe, seul ou en partenariat, des positions de premier plan mondial ou européen sur ses marchés. Safran s'engage dans des programmes de recherche et développement qui préservent les priorités environnementales de sa feuille de route d'innovation technologique.

Safran est classé meilleur employeur mondial 2020 dans son secteur par le magazine Forbes.

Safran Electronics & Defense est un leader mondial de solutions et de services permettant d'observer, de décider et de guider pour les marchés civils et de défense. La société maîtrise des technologies d'intelligence embarquée dans de nombreux domaines et participe à de nombreux programmes innovants dans l'aéronautique, le spatial et la défense.

Job Function/Category:  Information Technology 

Employment Type:  Non-Exempt Full Time 

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy. Job Summary

This is an entry level role that provides college hires the opportunity to be involved in meaningful work/projects throughout the Information Technology organization. This position prepares candidates for advanced information technology positions through challenging assignments, and allows them to develop their skills the areas of Customer Care, and Call Center technologies such as Salesforce, MuleSoft and emerging technologies. This position is a direct report to IT Group Product Managers of Smart Services.

This is a multi-level position in PSEG's Information Technology department. The title and level assigned to the successful candidate will be determined by assessing skills, knowledge and related experience, learned through the interview process. For a Technology Professional must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and internship to 2 years of technology experience. For a Sr Technology Professional, must have 2 years or more years of technology experience

Job Responsibilities

•This position provides opportunity to be involved several product developments:

• Develop and support Digital Customer Channels. Participate in requirements gathering, solutions design, systems configuration and development for a variety of products such as Alexa, Google Home, Mobile App and MyAccount.

• Learn to execute projects through the PSEG's Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and CMMI inclusive of identifying, specifying and analyzing business requirements and processes and managing progress throughout the application design, test and implementation process using Agile and 2 Pizza concepts.

• Work with Product teams in Two Pizza Team approach similar to Amazon product development and CICD model.

• Develop and implement process improvements, Next Best Actions, Automation opportunities, and Pro-active communications for customer care applications.

• Become a subject matter expert (aka Product Consultant) for technical and solution architecture that will include configuration, development, integration, and customization of digital channel products.

Other:
• PSEG will not offer visa sponsorship in connection with these positions. Positions will be located in Newark, New Jersey in the PSEG General Office.
• Candidate must be able to travel within the State of NJ and to our PSEG Long Island locations.

Job Specific Qualifications

Required:
•• Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Information/Computer Security, Engineering or a related technical discipline i.e. STEM.
• Mininmum years of experience of internship of relevant experience within the IT field or an industry with reliance on technical expertise.
• This is a multi-level position and placement is dependent upon skills, knowledge and experience of the selected candidate.
o Technology Professional - must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and internship
o Sr Technology Professional - must have 2 years or more years of technology experience
• Overall strong technical proficiency in information technology/computer disciplines.
• Strong MS Office skills (i.e. Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Access)
• Programming Experience working with or related coursework .NET, HTML, SQL, C, C++, Java, JavaScript, NODE.JS, JQuery, REST API's, JSON, Angular or Object Oriented Design,
• Self-starting with the demonstrated ability to learn new technical concepts quickly.
• Detail oriented and demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills.
• Good written and oral communication skills.
• Good interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with clients, IT management and staff.
• Candidate must foster an inclusive work environment and respect all aspects of diversity. Successful candidate must demonstrate and value differences in others' strengths, perspectives, approaches, and personal choices.
Desired:

• Experience developing business process flows and soliciting business requirements
• Knowledge of Agile development and project management
• Certifications in technical specialties such as AWS, Mobile application development is desired
• Experience with mobile app development (iOS, Android)
• Alexa skill development

The Role

The Vice President will be responsible for building the analytics backbone for the TV sales distribution business, develop pricing models and advanced analytics techniques to support TV’s most strategic deals; help define deal strategies and collaborate with the teams around the world to obtain support and adoption of techniques and tools. The candidate must have

  • Exceptional analytical and financial modelling skills; background in business analytics and experience with data visualization tools.
  • Significant experience in bringing together business and analytics to deliver impact.
  • Ability to structure complex analytical problems and bring clarity in ambiguous situations.
  • Experience deriving and presenting insights to executives; be able to tell data stories through visuals.
  • Big picture thinker but also hands on and willing to dive into details. 

The Vice President will have three direct reports and an intern and will collaborate with regional analytics team members. The position will have an opportunity for international travel.

The Responsibilities
DEAL ANALYTICS & STRATEGIC INTIATIVES (40%):

  • DEAL ANALYTICS: Work with Sr Sales leaders to support major local/pan-regional deal negotiations. Provide Sales with actionable insights through deal analysis, title performance analysis and deal ROI analysis. Collaborate with various teams to provide recommendations on pricing, title curation and deal structures. Work cross functionally with sales strategy, sales planning, finance and research; build strong working relationships with Sr. executives in these teams.
  • STRATEGIC INTIATIVES: Lead efforts to provide analytics and tools/capabilities for SPE’s strategic initiatives. Work directly with the senior leaders driving these initiatives, pro-actively asses needs, succinctly communicate and get alignment and work cross-functionally to deliver outputs.

INNOVATION & TOOLS (40%)

Be a data and analytics evangelist in the organization. Promote and enable data-driven decision-making across the organization by creating capabilities that solve business problems.

  • DATA: Work with IT, Finance, Research and other internal teams as required to obtain needed data sources. Guide the team to clean and structure data such that it can be used rapidly for custom analysis and support tools. Guide with business logic along to shape technical path.
  • SELF-SERVICE TOOLS: Translate the analytics solutions for high impact business problems into self-service tools. Create business logic that the team then implements using data and analytics technologies (Tableau, Alteryx/Predictive Modeling Techniques, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence)
  • PRICING – Enhance methods/models used for pricing and deal valuations.
  • o Bring thought leadership on emerging businesses of AVOD and SVOD - including strategies and tools for pricing and title curation. 
  • o Bring analytical rigor on pricing and analytical frameworks. Develop techniques to evaluate SVOD title categorization and determine the percent and value of unsold product.
  • SPECIAL DATA PROJECTS – Work with other teams on strategic data projects.

BEST PRACTICES & THOUGHT LEADERSHIP (20%)

Push the organization towards new and improved ways to use data to draw insights and improve negotiations.

  • Lead discussions and annual conferences with Sales and Planners regarding new tools, analysis techniques that can help improve negotiations.
  • In collaboration with the regional teams capture best practices. 
  • Mentor Sales and Planning by packaging case studies and conducting regular sessions to share ideas/ approaches.

EDUCATION  

  • Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Statistics, Physics, Math, Engineering, Economics, Management, Finance, Data Science or Computer Science.
  • 7-10 years’ work experience.
  • Prior experience in management consulting or similar strategic roles (ideally with experience of running analytics projects or modules) and/or experience in an analytics role at an entertainment company.

SKILLS

  • Experience and skills to manage and nurture a team.
  • Ability to interact confidently with senior executives, be receptive but also have a point of view.
  • Ability to create a culture of collaboration with regional analytics teams by providing mentorship as needed.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills. Ability to tell a clear, concise, and actionable story with data.
  • Attention to the layout and design of how analytical information is presented.
  • Strong intellectual curiosity and love of problem-solving with a passion for getting involved to drive action for direct impact on business outcomes.
  • Self-motivated and able to operate independently with limited guidance and direction.
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, taking the initiative, managing multiple projects, and working under tight timeframes.
  • Has the courage to challenge ideas.

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy. Job Summary

Technology Professional:
The technology professional will be involved in the full systems life cycle and responsible for designing, coding, testing, implementing and supporting application software and systems. Technology Professionals will work closely with Business Analysts and Group Product Managers to understand the business requirements that drive the analysis and physical design of technical solutions.

Job Responsibilities

Responsibilities:
• Analyzes end-user needs and designs, develops and tests software to satisfy demand. Performs build versus buy analysis for business demand.
• Partners with business analysts to translate business requirements to application requirements. May evaluate existing applications and platforms and provides recommendations for improving application performance by conducting gap analysis, identifying feasible alternative solutions, and assisting in the scope of modifications.
• Creates process flowcharts, diagrams, and other related documentation; Develops technical workflows using different modeling techniques.
• Collaborates with enterprise architects and infrastructure to integrate applications and hardware.
• Ensures that the design and application implementation meets security and QA standards. Suggests fixes to issues by doing a thorough analysis of root cause and impact of the defect.
• Analyzes application reports to ensure that the functionality and performance meets all product and service level requirements.
• Codes applications using a disciplined development process. Works on coding tasks that require skills in multiple technical environments and knowledge of a specific business area.
• Provides daily support with resolution of escalated tickets. Applies operation break fixes and other proactive maintenance activities until permanent solutions can be implemented. Supports and participates in the software deployment process for new modules, upgrades and fixes to the production environment.
• Documents functions and changes to new or modified modules and test activities/results.
• Makes modules production-ready by moving them to libraries, completing forms, following procedures, completing version control documents, etc.

Job Specific Qualifications

Required Skills:

Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Technology, Computer Engineering or Information Sciences preferred, or relevant experience.
• Level of experience required ranges from internship to 4 years of relevant experience within the IT field or an industry with reliance on technical expertise.
• Basic knowledge of the practical application of role specific engineering science and technology including applying principles, techniques, procedures, and equipment to the design and production of various goods and services.
• Experience working with or related coursework to write software code in both web and client/server environments such as:
- Software Languages: Java, .Net, C, C++, HTML, XML, SQL, VBA, Node.js, Swift
- Operating Systems: Windows, Linux
- Relational Databases: SQL Server, Oracle, Aurora, Postgres, MongoDB
- Experience designing graphical user interfaces using graphical design tools (e.g. Photoshop, MS Visio)
- Experience with mobile app development (iOS, Android)
- Alexa skill development
• MS Office skills (i.e. Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Access
• Ability to work independently and multi-task effectively.
• Flexible and willing to accept a change in priorities as necessary.
• Self-starting with the demonstrated ability to learn new technical concepts quickly.
• Detail oriented and demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills.
• Ability to learn new business and technical concepts.
• Good written and oral communication skills.

Desired Skills :

Overall strong technical proficiency in information technology/computer disciplines.
• Relevant certification is preferred such as Amazon Web Services (AWS)
• Experience with translating business requirements into system functional and non-functional requirements.
• Experience with business and system process flow techniques using UML (e.g. Use Case Diagrams, Activity Diagrams, Entity Relationship Diagrams).
• Experience with specific phases of the software development life cycle, especially Agile, Iterative, and Waterfall.
• Ability to create both technical and non-technical end-user documentation.
• Basic knowledge of the practical application of role specific engineering science and technology including applying principles, techniques, procedures, and equipment to the design and production of various goods and services.
• Demonstrated understanding of projects from the perspective of both client and business.
